name: Shrimp Satay Recipe With Thai Peanut Sauce
description: Easy shrimp satay recipe with Thai peanut sauce, perfect for any summer BBQ! Enjoy them warm or cold.

recipeInstructions.text: Clean the shrimp, remove veins, and keep the tails intact or removed, as preferred. Mix coconut milk, yellow curry powder, and rosdee flavor seasoning in a large bowl, then add shrimp. Allow the shrimp to marinate for 20 minutes. During this time, also submerge your skewers in water to avoid charring during grilling.
recipeInstructions.name: Clean the shrimp, remove veins, and keep the tails intact or removed, as preferred. Mix coconut milk, yellow curry powder, and rosdee flavor seasoning in a large bowl, then add shrimp. Allow the shrimp to marinate for 20 minutes. During this time, also submerge your skewers in water to avoid charring during grilling.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the roasted peanuts in a food processor or blender until finely ground. Prepare the shallots and garlic in the same way.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the roasted peanuts in a food processor or blender until finely ground. Prepare the shallots and garlic in the same way.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a pan over medium-low heat. Once the oil is heated, sauté the shallots and garlic until they’re golden and fragrant.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a pan over medium-low heat. Once the oil is heated, sauté the shallots and garlic until they’re golden and fragrant.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the massaman curry paste into the pan, stirring for approximately one minute to release its fragrance.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the massaman curry paste into the pan, stirring for approximately one minute to release its fragrance.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour in the coconut milk, followed by palm sugar, tamarind paste, rosdee seasoning powder, and salt. Stir the mixture continuously, allowing it to simmer for around 2 minutes, or until the palm sugar has completely dissolved into the sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour in the coconut milk, followed by palm sugar, tamarind paste, rosdee seasoning powder, and salt. Stir the mixture continuously, allowing it to simmer for around 2 minutes, or until the palm sugar has completely dissolved into the sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir the ground peanuts into the sauce and then remove the pan from the heat. Your peanut sauce is now complete.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir the ground peanuts into the sauce and then remove the pan from the heat. Your peanut sauce is now complete.

recipeInstructions.text: Thread the marinated shrimp onto the pre-soaked skewers.
recipeInstructions.name: Thread the marinated shrimp onto the pre-soaked skewers.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the shrimp skewers on a grilling pan or over a charcoal flame, turning them occasionally, until they are thoroughly cooked with a slight char on the outside. Serve immediately with your peanut sauce. Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the shrimp skewers on a grilling pan or over a charcoal flame, turning them occasionally, until they are thoroughly cooked with a slight char on the outside. Serve immediately with your peanut sauce. Enjoy!

keywords: shrimp satay, shrimp satay with peanut sauce
